Reviews.Title: Wife Loves the Commando
Reviews.Author: Charles D. Jones, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my wife who has dropped her phone in water more than once. The Commando is the perfect phone for the outdoor types where you don't have to worry about dropping the phone or getting it wet.  Even though it's milspec, the phone is no heavier than other smart phones we've owned.  Our son has the older, 3G version that has gone through the laundry at college more than once without any problems whatsoever. Highly recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Basically Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Mind Control
Reviews.Content: The phone I upgraded from: Droid X2The phone I traded this in for after the camera just stopped working: Droid RazrMIf you do some research about this phone you will find mixed reviews across the internet from the forums, the verizon website, and now Amazon! Also the product website is, pretty intense... I wasn't impressed. If you aren't terribly picky and you like this phone's style try it out, that's what I did. I wasn't thrilled with the fact it was an older version of android OS and the Casio stuff that comes with is more kitschy than it is useful. After having it for three days I was going to keep it for the durability and it wasn't a terrible phone, but then the camera just stopped working. No drops, no roots, just normal use it went kaput. So after doing more research it seemed like the people who really liked the phone had reprogramed it, since I'm not into that sort of thing I decided to exchange the Commando 4G for the Razr M.I wouldn't say its a bad phone, but I was very unfamiliar with the way it was set up because of the extra G'z apps. The calls sounded good, and there are front facing speakers so the external audio is real good. The screen is on the smaller side and there are numerous people who have cracked their screens already. The people who appeared to really get the most out of this phone are the ones who could re-program(rooting) it, and I'm not interested in that. I think as of today three months after the debut of this device that has a MSRP of $450. Verizon is giving this phone away right now, think about that. Realistically I would recommend a more popular phone or a brand of device you preferred with the most rugged case available most are water resistant(and a dry bag if waterproof is a must) instead of the G'zone.Bottom line: Wanted to like it, but was a little wary when the camera on this "rugged" phone was a lemon. So I returned it, did what I recommend and I'm pleased so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone if you are looking for ruggedness.  I had been using my wife's old Droid 2 until my contract was up.  I dropped it one night, battery flew out, and the phone, of course, fell in a puddle.  Thing was junk after that, apparently I knocked the antenna loose, so it functioned but wouldn't get any signal.  My dad had the 3G version and is pretty rough on it, he has had no problems whatsoever.  So I purchased another Droid 2 on Ebay to get me through until this phone FINALLY came out.  I think I got it a day or two after it was released.  I like  to wait a few months before I review anything.  This phone has been fantastic.  It has locked up once or twice, usually when I hadn't rebooted it in a while and had done several app updates.  I think that is a problem you'll have with about any smartphone.  It does not have the greatest specs, but for the normal web browser and occaisional game player, it works just fine for me.  I have dropped it numerous times, usually in a parking lot onto concrete/asphalt, with out any problems resulting from the drops.  Pretty good battery life, but I am not a heavy user.  There is an extended battery for it, $50 from Verizon.  I know you can get an otterbox for other phones, but it just makes it bigger and more bulky than most phones are already.  You won't need any such case for this phone while recieving the same level of protection.  Camera is pretty good, I was fairly impressed actually.  (Hint:  This goes for any phone's camera, if you scratch the lens and your pictures are coming out blurry or hazy, get some DVD/CD repair and use that, worked miracles on the camera lens on my phone). All in all, I have no complaints about this phone and would recommend it to anyone who is hard on there phones.

Reviews.Title: Great durable phone
Reviews.Author: Debbie Kirchoffner
Reviews.Content: Nice phone for a hard working man!  Only downfall is that it gets glitches and needs to be reset (take battery out) from time to time.

Reviews.Title: Casio G'zone Commando 4G
Reviews.Author: Victoria
Reviews.Content: Bigger screen than the original, more fun apps too. Loved the old one, it survived everything, even being run over by a car! So I knew I had to get the new one, and not because my old one was dead. Ha! Thank you casio!

Reviews.Title: Wish it had a longer battery life
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Daubert
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my husband he said its antena and battery are not as good as his other phone he also said the key board letters are to small for his fingers. He is getting the hang of using the voice command instead. He loves the camera. He says he is getting use to it but overall he does like the phone.

Reviews.Title: Just a better version of the 3g GzOne
Reviews.Author: J. Silvers
Reviews.Content: Much better than the 3g Casio GzOne.  Faster and the touch screen is not only more accurate but I have found it more durable too.

Reviews.Title: upgraded phone
Reviews.Author: KCC "KCC"
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from previous Commando phone (which still works!) and it shows great improvementin speed and capabilities.  Strong and break resistant.

Reviews.Title: Indestructible
Reviews.Author: Melissa Renner
Reviews.Content: This is the upgrade from the Casio C771 and I LOVE this version so much!  I had the C771 for two years and it still works, too (albeit it is very slow).The G'Zone 4G LTE here has be greatly improved from it's predecessor. Still just as rugged and tough, but a lot sleeker.  Both myself and my husband each have this model and have yet to have any issues with durability.  He is in law enforcement and has jumped into rivers with it, rolled in the mud with it, etc and there isn't even a scratch!As for myself, I am SUPER clumsy and break phones just by looking cross-eyed at them, and I can't break this (or the older model for that matter).  Mine has been dropped on concrete, tile, asphalt, and every other place known to man and mine still looks new.  Mind you, all this WITHOUT any protective cases!  These are the only phones we've ever owned that did NOT need Otterboxes or other waterproof cases.I will admit, that the features on this phone aren't as hi-tech as an iPhone or Samsung Galaxy, but the trade-off is minimal when you're not having to replace/replace the phone every few months because of damage.

Reviews.Title: CASIO G’zOne Commando® 4G LTE
Reviews.Author: Martin L. Litwin
Reviews.Content: I have had my CASIO G’zOne Commando® 4G LTE for about one year now. I have dropped it too many times to count, I’m a clumsy guy. Dropping never hurt it. It has been fine, no problems until it went through the clothes washer. That killed it. The charging port came open or was not closed all the way prior to the wash. I could not get it to recover even after the bag of rice for 3+ days or out in the sun on a hot dry day. Boots up quickly enough, sincs into my car Bluetooth quickly. I downloaded my iTunes via MP3 and it plays music wirelessly in my car via Bluetooth. I will replace with the same phone as soon as I am eligible for an upgrade, about two months.I recommend the cradle charger so the USB port plug does not need to be opened. I will be purchasing with my next phone.

Reviews.Title: Lemon - i wish I chose the one everyone else is getting
Reviews.Author: Cameron M. Fultz
Reviews.Content: The first one I got started freezing randomly every other day or more than once per day. Then I sent it back to factory for a refurbished and about four weeks later  the same crap happens - phone freeze for no reason at all.  I treat it very tenderly.Think twice!!!! During an emergency you may need to remove the battery and reinstall to get the phone to reboot and work correctly for a time.

Reviews.Title: So far So good
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for a month now and it is my first smart phone so it's hard to compare it however compared to my spouse's who has had one for several years it compares nicely.  I've alot to learn but so far so good.  It appears rugged for my needs in the outdoors, the battery life on mine is good for a day and a half.  The camera is very decent.  I am still getting used to the sensitivity but getting better.  So far I am liking this phone just fine.  No problems

Reviews.Title: battey issues
Reviews.Author: Donna F.
Reviews.Content: battery issues stays in locked mode had to go to dealer 2x  already nned to fix the battery issue could be a nice phone

Reviews.Title: NOT HAPPY !  Needs a RESET button
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone (rather the samsung III) on the advice from Verizon wireless sales person due to the enhanced ruggedness and water resistance.  I am VERY disappointed with this phone (my first smart-phone). I have returned to the Verizon Wireless store three times to complain about the constant "lock-ups". The responses has been the same each time; " yeah, they do that... just take the battery out for a second or two and then it will be fine".  REALLY !??  That's what I need to do with my brand new phone !??  TWO or THREE times a day, really !?!?!? It sounds like defective design or equipment to me, and yet I'm told to just deal with it....  The phone will drop a phone call if a text message comes in while you are talking.  If this is so "normal" for this phone they should have a reset button on the case like my old PC.  In one month of ownership, I've almost worn out the rear-cover locking tab.UPDATE: >>>  The phone now shuts off and restarts (reboots) automatically, even when fully charged, just sitting there on the table...  I tried to return this phone. The best Verison wireless will do is exchange for another one like it.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Maggie the Cat
Reviews.Content: My husband had a previous version of the Commando that has lasted over 2 years.  It was great, very durable, survived all the demands placed on it.  He loved it.  Then he 'upgraded' to the new phone.  It lasted 7 whole days before it shattered.  Verizon would do nothing to fix the problem.  So basically it cost over $20 a day for the week and had to be replaced, burning through another upgrade.  And if the new one doesn't make it through Week 2?  It will only be $100 to replace it again.  What happened to the great, sturdy, reliable Commando?  The newest version is a horrible disappointment

Reviews.Title: Solid phone and a great upgrade from my old Commando which I loved
Reviews.Author: R. Benninghoven
Reviews.Content: First off I only gave this phone 4 stars because nothing is perfect. Boots up really fast, display is beautiful and a little larger then the old model. As a side note, every cell phone I've ever had has been glitchy. A lot of reviews on this phone say it's glitchy at times. I haven't had any problems yet and will do a follow up review a few months down the road. The 4g Lte really makes a difference compared to the old model with the 3g service. My only complaint is with all cell phones being loaded up with apps from service providers that I never use. Great rugged phone, worth a try.

Reviews.Title: let's do something
Reviews.Author: hermenegildo J aldana
Reviews.Content: For the kind of job I do this is the perfect device, tough and dependable and fully  meet my expectations

Reviews.Title: Not "Rugged"
Reviews.Author: Samantha Hadley
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as an upgrade from the c771. I enjoyed the 4g and new features but the darn thing fell off a HMMWV, maybe 6 feet, and the screen shattered. I am definitely reverting to the old system because this 4g one is to soft.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: D. Calderon "Tech Geek"
Reviews.Content: Love It!! I have enough to worry about in my life, it's nice to not have to worry about my phone. Great Phone!!! Buy It!!

ProductInfo.Name: Casio G'zOne Commando 4G LTE, Black 16GB (Verizon Wireless)
